To become a Woloo Host, you need to have WAH (Woloo Assurance of Hygiene) certification. All Woloo washrooms are certified in association with the Toilet Board Coalition (A Global non-profit enterprise working under World Bank to improve sanitation standards across 40+ countries) & the Woloo Assurance of Hygiene (WAH) based on safety, hygiene & accessibility parameters.

Woloo Assurance of Hygiene (WAH) is a symbol of commitment to every Woloo customer towards providing Safe, Hygienic & Accessible washrooms. The mission of WAH is to provide a compliance guide & certification for Woloo-Hosts (restaurants/QSR & other facilities) to improve the standard of hygiene & their toilet facility.
In order to be WAH (Woloo Assurance of Hygiene) certified, the Host must fulfil the following pre-requisites:
Location accessibility: The Woloo Host’s retail facility must be well located. The washroom must be easily accessible and conveniently located.
Safety & Security: The Woloo Host’s facility must be safe and secure for women customers.
Hygiene & Cleanliness: The Woloo Host must ensure that high standards of hygiene and cleanliness are maintained at all times & should be the top priority.
Quality of Fitting & Facilities: The fittings in the toilet must be of high quality and should be well maintained.
Hospitality & Courtesy: The host must ensure courteous and comfortable hospitality standards towards all customers.

Understanding Your Ovulation Cycle: 
Ovulation typically occurs around the midpoint of your menstrual cycle. Recognizing the signs can help with family planning or conception.


Signs of Ovulation:

Increased cervical mucus (clear and stretchy). 
1.Mild abdominal pain (mittelschmerz). 
2.Elevated basal body temperature. 

Timing for Conception: 
The fertile window is typically six days leading up to ovulation and the day of ovulation itself.


Tips for Tracking Ovulation:

1.Use ovulation predictor kits for accurate tracking. 
2.Monitor changes in your body. 
3.Maintain a healthy lifestyle to support reproductive health.

Understanding Your Pregnancy Cycle: 
The pregnancy cycle typically lasts about 40 weeks and is divided into three trimesters.


First Trimester (Weeks 1-12): 
This is a crucial period for fetal development. You may experience symptoms like nausea, fatigue, and mood swings. Its important to schedule your first prenatal visit during this time.


Second Trimester (Weeks 13-26): 
Often considered the easiest trimester, many women experience increased energy and reduced nausea. This is the time for routine screenings and ultrasounds.


Third Trimester (Weeks 27-40): As your body prepares for labor, you might feel more discomfort. Regular check-ups will monitor your and your baby’s health.


Tips for a Healthy Pregnancy:

1.Stay hydrated and maintain a balanced diet. 
2.Attend all prenatal appointments. 
3.Engage in safe physical activities. 
4.Consider joining prenatal classes for support and education.

Understanding Your Menstruation Cycle: 
The average menstrual cycle lasts about 28 days, but it can vary from 21 to 35 days. Tracking your cycle helps in understanding your body’s rhythms.


Menstrual Phase (Days 1-5): 
This is when you have your period, and the lining of the uterus sheds.


Follicular Phase (Days 1-13): 
Hormones stimulate the growth of follicles in the ovaries, leading to the maturation of an egg.


Ovulation (Day 14): 
Around the middle of your cycle, the matured egg is released, which is the optimal time for conception.


Luteal Phase (Days 15-28): 
If the egg isn’t fertilized, hormone levels drop, leading to the next menstrual phase.


Tips for Managing Your Cycle:

1.Keep track of your cycle to anticipate symptoms. 
2.Stay active and maintain a balanced diet. 
3.Use pain relief methods if you experience cramps.

string.name: consent_sign
string.b: Accessibility Service: Woloo uses Accessibility services permission with active consent of the end-user. The Accessibility permissions are used for analysing the application usage on this device as part of an opt-in market research panel.

resources.string:
\nWoloo collects list of Applications installed in the user Mobile on a regular basis. The installed application list is used for
analytics & for DMP based monetization.

Via this application Woloo can:


1. Collect on regular basis the list of All the applications in my phone.


2. For specific apps ONLY, Woloo will collect detailed app usage behaviour.

With a vision to provide hygiene dignity to all women, Woloo brings a tech enabled loo-discovery mobile App that helps women to locate the nearest clean & hygienic washrooms, whenever they are away from their home or office. Woloo, curates, aggregates & certifies these washrooms hosted by restaurants, Cafes & all kinds of retail Stores. 

Accessibility Service : Woloo uses Accessibility services permission with active consent of the end-user. The Accessibility permissions are used for analysing the application usage on this device as part of an opt-in market research panel. 

Woloo collects a list of Applications installed in the user Mobile on a regular basis. The installed application list is used for analytics and for DMP based monetization. 


To facilitate this Woloo application collects: 
1. Location information to understand the city of usage. 
2. The Mobile number to contact the user if required; 
3. List of apps installed in the mobile phone on a regular basis; 
4. Usage behaviour of the user of relevant apps only; 
5. Audio, Video OTT and e-commerce app usage details; and 
6. Ads seen in social apps.


Woloo offers this service via two options 

1) Free - we will need accessibility permission and the data will be used for market research, Data management platform -DMP, generating analytics of mobile application usage and consumption behaviour etc. Woloo offers 365 days of subscription free for the user in this plan. By choosing the free option, the user declares “I understand that by downloading, installing this application and by agreeing to the terms and conditions, I have voluntarily agreed to provide my usage data for the above mentioned purpose. I understand that transferring data to VTION’s backend from the application may use data connectivity from my phone, either cellular or Wi-Fi. This will be minimum in quantum and will be part of my usage on mobile data plan/Wi-Fi plan as the case maybe. I am compensated with a suitable incentive of the free service for 365 days. I agree that till I continue to keep the application on my phone and hereby consent to Woloo for usage of my data even after I uninstall the application”. 

2) Paid- In the paid version the user gets an initial 7 days of subscription for free. Later he can purchase the subscription on a monthly basis for INR 99 and yearly INR 365.


All the data provided by our users are uploaded to secure servers in India on the cloud that is controlled by woloo . The application communicates with the server on https://a.vtion.in domain. Payload details on what the application sends into servers can be requested by contacting us at support@woloo.in. We also have a ‘Wipeout’ policy which will delete all Personally Identifiable Information associated with a user’s account. To do the same please contact us on support@woloo.in


The information collected will be analysed and shared as part of industry reports in an anonymised form. Further this information will be also uploaded in various Data Management Platforms (DMP) for third party advertisement purposes. For a complete overview of how we use the data shared by a user please go over our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.

As a user you hereby declare and accept the following: 

 “I understand that transferring data to VTION’s backend from the application may use data connectivity from my phone, either cellular or Wi-Fi. This will be minimum in quantum and will be part of my usage on mobile data plan/Wi-Fi plan as the case maybe. I am compensated with a suitable incentive of the free service for 365 days. I agree that till I continue to keep the application on my phone and hereby consent to Woloo for usage of my data even after I uninstall the application”.
